description: From Latin coalēscō, from co- + alēscō (“grow up”).

verbs.description: coalesce (third-person singular simple present coalesces, present participle coalescing, simple past and past participle coalesced)

entries.meaning: (of separate elements) To join into a single mass or whole.
examples: The droplets coalesced into a puddle.

entries.meaning: (of a whole or a unit) To form from different pieces or elements.
examples: The puddle coalesced from the droplets as they ran together.

entries.meaning: (engineering) To bond pieces of metal into a continuous whole by liquefying parts of each piece, bringing the liquids into contact, and allowing the combined liquid to solidify.
(of separate groups or persons) To merge, to intermingle freely.
